metadata.title: CVE-2018-17540 on Ubuntu 18.04 LTS (bionic) - medium
metadata.description:
The gmp plugin in strongSwan before 5.7.1 has a Buffer Overflow via acrafted certificate.

    Update Instructions:

    Run `sudo pro fix CVE-2018-17540` to fix the vulnerability. The problem can be corrected
    by updating your system to the following package versions:

charon-cmd - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
charon-systemd - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
libcharon-extra-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
libcharon-standard-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
libstrongswan - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
libstrongswan-extra-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
libstrongswan-standard-plugins - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-charon - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-libcharon - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-nm - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-pki - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-scepclient - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-starter - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-swanctl - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-tnc-base - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-tnc-client - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-tnc-ifmap - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-tnc-pdp - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
strongswan-tnc-server - 5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3
No subscription required

criterions.comment: strongswan package in bionic was vulnerable but has been fixed (note: '5.6.2-1ubuntu2.3').
